page.title: 15Leisure in Morchard Bishop
page.content: A flourishing playgroup meets 2 mornings each week in the hall.For those of school age there are Scout and Guide groups,Girls's Brigade and a church choir.Occasionaly a concert or pantomime will draw in many from all age groups.About 40 members support the gardening club,which organises an annual show.The London Inn a skittle alley,while some prefer to join the British Legion or Women's Institute. There is no 'common land' for walking and few have time or energy for a leisurely stroll,but some more hardy souls pass through the village which has a stone to mark the halfway point on the Two Moors Way between Dartmoor and Exmoor.Some of the farming community enjoy a day's hunting and the annual hunt ball.Most spend their leisure time at home watching T.V..
